XRInputSourceArray.summary: NOTE Experimental The interface XRInputSourceArray represents a live list of WebXR input sources, and is used as the return value of the property . Each entry is an representing one input device connected to the WebXR system.

remarks.para: In addition to being able to access the input sources in the list using standard array notation (that is, with index numbers inside square brackets), methods are available to allow the use of iterators and the method is also available.

XRInputSourceArrayEntries.summary:
NOTE Experimental The interface's
entries() method returns a JavaScript
iterator
which can then be used to iterate over the key/value pairs in the input source
array. Each item in the array is an object.

remarks.para:
Most frequently, you will use this in tandem with statements such as
for...of.

XRInputSourceArrayEntries.returns:
An iterator
which can be used to walk through the list of XRInputSource objects
included in the input source array.

XRInputSourceArrayForEach.summary:
NOTE Experimental The
method forEach() executes the specified callback once for
each input source in the array, starting at index 0 and progressing until the end of the
list.

remarks.para:
-Inputs and input sources
-The
Array method forEach()
-

XRInputSourceArrayKeys.summary:
NOTE Experimental The keys() method in the
interface returns a {{Glossary("JavaScript")}}
iterator
which can then be used to iterate over the keys used to reference each item in the array
of input sources.

remarks.para:
-Inputs and input sources
-The method
-The Array method keys()
-

XRInputSourceArrayKeys.returns:
A
JavaScript iterator that
can be used to walk through the keys for each entry in the list of input sources. The
values returned by the iterator are the indexes of each entry in the list; that is, the
numbers 0, 1, 2, and so forth through the index of the last item in the list.

XRInputSourceArrayLength.summary:
NOTE Experimental The read-only length property returns an integer value
indicating the number of items in the input source list represented by
the object.
XRInputSourceArrayLength.value:
An integer value indicating the number of objects
representing WebXR input sources are included in the array.

XRInputSourceArrayValues.summary:
NOTE Experimental The
method values() returns a JavaScript
iterator
that can walk over the list of objects contained in the
array, from first to last.

remarks.para:
-Inputs and input sources
-The method
-The
Array method values()
-

XRInputSourceArrayValues.returns:
A
JavaScript iterator that
can be used to walk through the list of objects in the
array, starting with the first entry (at index 0) and proceeding straight through the
list.
